definition:
Let $\kappa$ be a limit ordinal (e.g. a cardinal). The [*cofinality of
$\kappa$*]{} $\operatorname{cf}(\kappa)$ could also be defined as:
$$\operatorname{cf}(\kappa)=\inf \{ |U| : U \subseteq \kappa \text{ such that } \sup \; U = \kappa \}$$
($\sup \; U$ is calculated using the natural order of the ordinals). The
cofinality of a cardinal is always a regular cardinal and hence
$\operatorname{cf}(\kappa) = \operatorname{cf}(\operatorname{cf}(\kappa))$.

This definition is equivalent to the parent definition.
